turns.content:
Please make my cover letter more concise: It would be an honor and privilege to work for AMD as a Data Centre Power and Performance Co-op Student through Toronto Metropolitan University’s Co-op portal and share the company’s goal to lead the next era of vivid digital experiences with its ground-breaking AMD Accelerated Processing Units (APUs). My strive for innovation and a craving passion to learn more about computer hardware and electronic designs are reasons why I am aspiring to become an Electrical Engineer. Being an individual who enjoys a fast-paced, dynamic environment, I aspire to get involved with a wide variety of projects whilst offering my strong analytical, problem solving, and interpersonal skills. As a third-year Electrical Engineering student, I hope to contribute towards the success of AMD through my actions, academic knowledge, projects, and my experiences inside and outside of university. 
As a highly dedicated student that is well- accomplished in the fields of customer service and communication capabilities and proficient to the world of technology and administration, I strongly believe that I will have a positive impact towards your company. This is shown though my 4 years of experience as a Retail Associate at McDonalds, 10+ months of experiences as an Administrative Assistant and Support, and through my previous extracurricular experiences. Working at McDonalds helped me develop my coordination and teamworking skills in a fast- paced work environment. My friendly demeanor, coupled with my multitasking abilities, helped me to communicate with customers effectively while placing their orders and cash handling correctly. Moreover, learning to incorporate my organizational and computational skills as an Administrative Assistant and Support help me familiarize myself with reconciling data and organizing it in MS Excel. I strongly believe that my interpersonal and technical skills make me an ideal candidate for the position of Data Centre Power and Performance Co-op Student at AMD.
My academic background at Toronto Metropolitan University has been a balanced mix of design projects and theories in which I challenged myself daily to learn about algorithms, data structures, electronics circuit systems and object-oriented engineering analysis and design. During my CPS125 Digital Computation and Programming course, I led a group of 5 students in analyzing and creating unique algorithms to solve large information filling systems problems. I was responsible in facilitating team meetings, completing the final project report, and assisting with research and developing a binary search algorithm to satisfy specific conditions provided by the problem. This 4-week project provided me with the opportunity to work with a group of like-minded individuals and utilize my analytical skills to solve problems and showcase my project management skills. During the quarantine in 2021, I took the initiative to complete the CS50 Series Course by Harvard University to learn various programing languages. Using the knowledge from this course, I was able to develop my own version of Black- Jack, Tic Tac Toe, and Hangman using Java and Python. During the winter 2022 semester, I was able to develop a merge sort algorithm (garbage collection included) with C using the knowledge learned from data structures and linked lists.
Thanks to my academic background in electronics and my hands on experience using lab hardware such as oscilloscopes, function generators, and spectrum analyzers, knowledge regarding analog/digital circuit analysis, reading schematics, software architecture, design and debugging, concept regarding power and performance are a few things I crave to learn more about. Additionally, being part of Toronto Met Formula Racing gave me an insight into hardware engineering and gaining technical experience by engaging with other sub-team members within the electrical drivetrain sub-team.
Overall, I am confident that I will easily transition into the role of Data Centre Power and Performance Co-op Student and effectively contribute to the engineering team at AMD. I look forward to the opportunity to meet with you personally and arrange a time to further discuss my qualifications. Thank you for your time and consideration. You may contact me though my phone number, 647-717-5780 and my personal email, aman.ayaz44@gmail.com.

Dear Hiring Manager,

I am excited to apply for the Data Centre Power and Performance Co-op Student position at AMD. As an Electrical Engineering student at Toronto Metropolitan University, I am committed to contributing to the company's goal of leading the next era of vivid digital experiences with its innovative AMD Accelerated Processing Units (APUs). My passion for innovation and desire to learn more about computer hardware and electronic design make me an ideal candidate for this role.

In addition to my strong analytical, problem solving, and interpersonal skills, I have 4 years of experience as a Retail Associate at McDonalds, 10+ months of experience as an Administrative Assistant and Support, and various extracurricular experiences. These roles have helped me develop my coordination and teamworking skills, as well as my ability to communicate effectively with customers and organize data using MS Excel.

In my academic studies, I have excelled in design projects and theory, including algorithms, data structures, electronics circuit systems, and object-oriented engineering analysis and design. I have also taken the initiative to learn various programming languages, such as Java and Python, and have developed my own versions of Black- Jack, Tic Tac Toe, and Hangman. My hands-on experience with lab hardware and my involvement in Toronto Met Formula Racing have given me valuable technical experience and insight into hardware engineering.

I am confident that my academic background and practical experience make me well-suited for the Data Centre Power and Performance Co-op Student position at AMD. I am excited to apply my skills and learn more about the industry while making a positive impact on the company. Thank you for considering my application.

Sincerely,
[Your Name]
Can you please include all my past experiences but also make it more lengthy.

Dear Hiring Manager,

I am excited to apply for the Data Centre Power and Performance Co-op Student position at AMD. As an Electrical Engineering student at Toronto Metropolitan University, I am committed to contributing to the company's goal of leading the next era of vivid digital experiences with its innovative AMD Accelerated Processing Units (APUs). My passion for innovation and desire to learn more about computer hardware and electronic design make me an ideal candidate for this role.

Throughout my academic and professional career, I have developed a strong foundation in technical skills and customer service. I have 4 years of experience as a Retail Associate at McDonalds, where I honed my coordination and teamworking skills in a fast-paced work environment. I also developed excellent communication skills, as I was responsible for interacting with customers, placing orders, and handling cash transactions.

In addition to my experience in customer service, I have also gained experience in administration as an Administrative Assistant and Support. In this role, I utilized my organizational and computational skills to reconcile data and organize it in MS Excel. My friendly demeanor and multitasking abilities allowed me to effectively communicate with colleagues and customers.

In addition to my professional experience, I have also participated in various extracurricular activities that have helped me develop my technical skills and interpersonal abilities. As a member of Toronto Met Formula Racing, I gained valuable technical experience and insight into hardware engineering by engaging with other sub-team members within the electrical drivetrain sub-team. I have also taken the initiative to learn various programming languages, such as Java and Python, and have developed my own versions of Black-Jack, Tic Tac Toe, and Hangman.

My academic background at Toronto Metropolitan University has been a balanced mix of design projects and theory, including algorithms, data structures, electronics circuit systems, and object-oriented engineering analysis and design. During my CPS125 Digital Computation and Programming course, I led a group of 5 students in analyzing and creating unique algorithms to solve large information filling systems problems. I was responsible for facilitating team meetings, completing the final project report, and assisting with research and development of a binary search algorithm. This 4-week project provided me with the opportunity to work with a group of like-minded individuals and utilize my analytical skills to solve problems, as well as showcase my project management skills.

Thanks to my academic background in electronics and my hands-on experience using lab hardware such as oscilloscopes, function generators, and spectrum analyzers, I have gained knowledge in areas such as analog/digital circuit analysis, reading schematics, software architecture, design and debugging, and concepts regarding power and performance. I am eager to continue learning and expanding my knowledge in these areas as a Data Centre Power and Performance Co-op Student at AMD.

I am confident that my academic background and practical experience make me well-suited for the Data Centre Power and Performance Co-op Student position at AMD. I am excited to apply my skills and learn more about the industry while making a positive impact on the company. Thank you for considering my application.

Sincerely,
[Your Name]
